etymologies: mid 18th century: from French dentiste, from dent ‘tooth’, from Latin dens, dent-

definitions: a person qualified to treat the diseases and conditions that affect the teeth and gums, especially the repair and extraction of teeth and the insertion of artificial ones

examples.text: his mouth is still sore from his visit to the dentist's

shortDefinitions: person who is qualified to treat diseases and other conditions that affect teeth and gums
